conclusion: A 5m wooden rod is suspended from a fixed point.
The rod is released from rest and falls freely (no air resistance).
Point A is 20m below the suspension point.
We need to find t₁, the time when the bottom end of the rod passes through point A.
When the rod is released, it falls under gravity with acceleration g = 10 m/s².
We need to find when the bottom end of the rod reaches point A.

premise: Define y as the position of the top end of the rod, with y = 0 at the suspension point (positive downward).
conclusion: Set up the coordinate system with y = 0 at the suspension point.

premise: For an object falling from rest under gravity: y(t) = (1/2)gt²
conclusion: Find the position as a function of time: y(t) = (1/2)gt²

premise: The top end of the rod is at position y(t). The bottom end is 5m below the top end, so its position is y(t) + 5m.
conclusion: Determine when the bottom end of the rod reaches point A: y(t₁) + 5m = 20m
